intro: Cylindrolobus oliviacamposiae, commonly known as the olive fields sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Floristic Region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, ribbed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, three-parted flowers, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
